page.title: 03Sallachy; Loch Long
page.content: Every visitor to Lochalsh ought to take the opportunity of driving or walking the road by the lochside. Loch Long at this point narrows to about 100 yards and it is difficult to remember it is tidal, with the mouth of the Loch 3 miles south at Dornie and the well known Eilean Doran Castle. The township of Sallachy is sustained by crofting, with salmon netting taking place in the Loch. The road continues Eastwards to its end at Killilan and Cames Luinie, where walkers leave the road to walk the 6 miles to the Falls of Glomach, one of the highest waterfalls in Scotland and a National Trust property.
